intro: Alyssum syriacum, commonly known as Syrian alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features dense clusters of blooms atop slender stems. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Alyssum syriacum is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
